intro: Cyphanthera albicans subsp. albicans, commonly known as the white-flowered cyphanthera, is a flowering plant native to Australia. It belongs to the family Fabaceae, which includes legumes, and is characterized by its slender, erect stems and small, white flowers. The plant typically grows in sandy or gravelly soils in arid or semi-arid regions. Its leaves are trifoliate, consisting of three small, oval-shaped leaflets. This subspecies is noted for its ecological significance, providing nectar for native pollinators and contributing to the biodiversity of its habitat.
